result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony M Gleason was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: To any other sentence. No Huber privileges. Court objects to ES.

miscConds.notes: *Pay restitution in the amount of $50.00 to Children's Hospital during term of probation or civil judgment.
*Pay all mandatory surcharges, fees and costs during term of probation or civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant.
*NO contact with Anthony S. or the speedway station.

timeConds.notes: Time stayed and to be used at the discretion of the agent for violations, 10 days first violation, 15 days second violation and 30 days for third violation.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Anthony M Gleason

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: REQUEST TO ISSUE CIVIL JUDGMENT FOR RESTITUTION RECEIVED AND FORWARDED TO ALI. OS
REQUEST TO ISSUE CIVIL JUDGMENT FRO RESTITUTION RECEIVED AND FORWARDED TO ALI. OS
Denying Request for Huber and Sentence Credit, signed and filed
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Misdemeanor Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. John Siefert, Br. 47, for review. mag
Defendant's pro se request for Huber privileges and sentence credit.

Defendant Anthony M Gleason in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  Defendant Anthony M Gleason in custody.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant waived rights and pled guilty.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 

 Defendant sentenced to serve ONE YEAR CONSECUTIVE TO ANY OTHER SENTENCE, in the House of Correction with credit for ZERO  days time served. NO  Huber privileges. Court objects to ES.   Court STAYED the sentence and placed defendant on Probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of TWO YEARS . 
Conditions: 
*defendant to pay all mandatory surcharges, fees and costs during term of probation or civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant. 
*aoda/any treatment deemed appropriate/random urine screens
*55 days condition time stayed and  to be used at the discretion of the agent for  violations, 10 days first violation, 15 days second violation and 30  days for third violation
*no contact with Anthony S. or the speedway station
*pay restitution in the amount of $50.00 to Children's Hospital during term of probation or civil judgment 

Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 07-13-2015 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant to be produced for the next court date if still in custody.

Attorney Danielle L. Shelton in court, defendant Anthony M Gleason not in court, in custody.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant has two cases before the court.
Bail motion commenced.  Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.  Bail remains as previously set.
No Contact Order to be addressed on the next court date as defendant not present in court.
Defense counsel requests adjournment for plea and sentencing.  Court orders case adjourned for plea and sentencing in Branch 47.
Clerk:  jms

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  
ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.

Defendant Anthony M Gleason in court with attorney Steven R. Wiechmann.  Defendant Anthony M Gleason in custody.  
Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  

DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for June 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
